column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 25-34 on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: Actually my experience was good. I'm not going to lie, I came across this website because when I first applied it yes I felt burning, tingling and intense itching so it made me panic BUT within a few hours my yeast infection was gone.ALSO there is a difference I notice between myself and alot of other women who took it. I did NOT apply it at bedtime. I actually applied it in the morning so I was up and about walking throughout the day. That may have something to do with it. Maybe its not good to use it and go to sleep. I put on a pad and went about my day. Another thing I did was used anti itch cream. That helped with the itching. Soooo I wouldn't say it's horrible.I'm only writing this because someone may be like I was earlier in a pinic thinking they are going  to experience it get worse. My advice is don't take it and go to sleep. Take it in the morning. I took it at 7:30am and by almost 4 felt soooo much better. Good luck ladies.

column1: Yeast Infection of Vagina and Vulva
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I chose Vagistat-1 to treat my vaginal yeast infection because of the ease of use and 1 day application.  It did take care of my infection, however it inflamed my vaginal area so much that I could hardly walk the following day.  It was exquisitly painful to the touch.  It was still painful on day 2 but much better.  I've used other brands 3 and 7 day preparations without incident and I will use them again when needed. I don't know if it's the 1 day dose or if I'm allergic to the active ingredient but I will never use this product again.
